urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG

@EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @EssexWildlife Priorities @EnvAgency? Signal crayfish are invasive and damaging. What we want you to tackle is the #sewage #pollution the water companies are pouring into our waterways!

@JamesBevanEA @samaritans It’s ok to talk about our mental health…however the @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA won’t listen to residents of #newcastleunderlyme who are having their mental health decimated by #whalleysquarry & @RedIndustries2 so thanks a bunch 🤦🏼‍♂️ @StinkStopthe

We can't believe this. 

😡 People are still taking BBQs to our moorland. 

Less than 3 weeks ago, our crews spent days tackling a devasting fire on Marsden Moor.

❌BBQs are BANNED on our moorland. ❌
If you see somebody with one, dial 999. 

#BeMoorAware.
@WestYorksPolice https://t.co/uYGdxKfFw9

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP

During an enforcement patrol we found two illegal crayfish traps at Chafford Gorges Nature Park☹️

We are working with @EssexWildlife and members of the community to stop illegal #fishing in the area. 

If you witness illegal fishing please report it to 0800 807060 📞 #Essex https://t.co/HA2c41GU2e
We are delighted to welcome @RichardHRBenyon as our new Lords Minister. Lord Benyon joins us following Lord Gardiner’s appointment as Senior Deputy Speaker at @UKHouseofLords. https://t.co/ZDIU82yBUT

tweets.text: Extraordinary thread from @SOPH_C_ what on earth is going on? @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/VtWzsj16Ik
@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA Because they dont want to find problems. They are scared of RED industries, they are praying that nobody dies from this because the EA will be brought to its knees.

@OffDanielHill @SimonTagg @SOPH_C_ @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL The @EnvAgency won’t do a thing.Toothless& useless.The govt are going to have to step in & stump up for this,can’t see how else it can be https://t.co/3sVVxPaqzM’s clearly likely to be full of unpleasant materials & needs to be made as safe as possible ASAP #stopthestink

Read our latest update to the situation at #WalleysQuarry #NewcastleUnderLyme here 👉 https://t.co/o558iAVicn 

A new gas flare we requested the operator to install was installed this week. It'll increase the amount of gas that can be collected & burnt off to help reduce odour. https://t.co/7KEj217PLA
@tayz_BETH @joanne_dodd Westlands tonight absolutely stinks. There you go @EnvAgencyMids no need to sniff tonight. Shocking unprofessional set up. Shame on you.
@greengrubsuk @Feargal_Sharkey @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySE We should stop beating ourselves up and start challenging the corporates destroying the planet.

The Environment Agency has now said it hadn’t been in consultation on the recommencement of works at Walleys Quarry landfill in Newcastle. 

The weekly update from the regulator says it was ‘informed of their decision’. https://t.co/z4Kz5nHsRb

The Environment Agency says the operators of Walleys Quarry will no longer accept waste from one of the companies who was trying to dispose of waste at the site. 

It says it will be investigating the waste operators whose rubbish was refused.

@Feargal_Sharkey @bristol_citizen @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency I thought tyre and road runoff is the highest contribution and source of micro plastics in aquatic ecosystems.  As consumers we should try to reduce before blaming others for our waste? @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgencySE #ClimateAction  #PlasticFreeSeas #plasticfreerivers

@EnvAgencyMids So the gas flare will reduce odours will it like all the actions of the enforcement notice , two weeks later it’s worse than ever . You now see why we don’t trust you ? Follow the paper trail @EnvAgencyMids and close the wretched place down .

Our enforcement officers, @AnglingTrust volunteers & @LancsPolice were cracking down on illegal fishing over the bank holiday weekend as part of Operation Clampdown 9. The patrol covered significant areas around #Preston where 3 offences were detected for unlicensed fishing. https://t.co/B3duYyTBJh

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency What of the folks in #NewcastleunderLyme, unable to 'connect with nature' due to the foul stench emanating from #WalleysQuarry Landfill?
You tweet about #MentalHealthAwarenessWeek but fail to connect locals MH issues with the EA's own inaction. Unbelievable! :-(

urls.title: Green finance: unlocking its potential for nature's recovery
urls.description: Exploring how innovative green finance could contribute to positive landscape-scale environmental changes.

tweets.text:
You can now book a place on our next "Networks for Nature" webinar on 20th May, 1 pm, where we will explore the potential of green finance to act as a catalyst for change with @JennyPhelpsMBE, Dan Turner from @theriverstrust @PaulCottington @EnvAgency.

tweets.text: More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time.
